title: Developer - Node/React
description:
*Vi tror på ett samhälle format av framgångsrika företag där entreprenörskap och samhällsnytta går hand i hand. Att vara en del av Fortnox är att vara en del av en ständig förändring - en förändring där du själv bestämmer hur långt du vill nå. Vårt största fokus är att ge dig rätt förutsättningar att få leva din passion tillsammans med oss. Var du kommer ifrån är inte relevant - det är vart du är på väg som är intressant för oss. Precis som vi igår inte kunde drömma om det Fortnox som finns idag, så kan du vara med och forma vilka vi är imorgon.*  

  

**Om tjänsten**  

Nu söker vi en **fullstackutvecklare** som blir en viktig pusselbit i att skapa en välkomnande, enkel och effektiv vardag för våra kunder. Hos oss kommer du att vara en del av teamen som arbetar med produkten **Bokslut & Skatt** – som är strategiskt viktig för Fortnox.


Som utvecklare arbetar du i ett **agilt team** som ansvarar för produkterna från ax till limpa. Du och teamet tar stort ansvar för lösningens utformning och arbetar tillsammans för att leverera kvalitativa lösningar och produkter som är innovativa, hållbara och enkla att förvalta.

**Vi söker dig som**

* Har minst några års erfarenhet av **professionell mjukvaruutveckling**.
* Rör dig med enkelhet mellan **backend** och **frontend**.
* Besitter goda kunskaper i **moderna programmeringstekniker**, gärna:


	+ **React** för frontendutveckling.
	+ **Node** för backend.
	+ Grundläggande förståelse för **PostgreSQL**
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i **agila utvecklingsteam**.
* Har en god förmåga att uttrycka dig tydligt i både **tal och skrift**, på svenska och engelska.
* Meriterande om man har någon form av redovisningskunskap, från tex från att ha drivit eget företag, utbildning eller från tidigare yrke.
* Meriterande om man har tidigare erfarenhet av roller som Tech lead eller liknande.


Fortnox är ett bolag i förändring och att arbeta hos oss innebär en omväxlande vardag. För att trivas i denna roll ser vi därför att du är lösningsorienterad och att du trivs med att jobba i en föränderlig miljö. Du är trygg i din kompetens, är självgående och tar gärna lead på kontinuerlig förbättring av metoder, verktyg och leveranser. Du håller dig uppdaterad om relevanta tekniker och verktyg, deltar i teambeslut och sprider gärna vidare din kunskap till dina kollegor på Fortnox.

**Tech stack:**


| Javascript | React | Node | Java | Kotlin | SQL | GIT |

**Vi erbjuder**


En plats i ett av våra autonoma team där vi kombinerar självständighet med ett nära samarbete. Här jobbar du i ett komplett team tillsammans med kompetenser inom produkt, design och teknik för att bygga lösningar i framkant.


På Fortnox är balans i livet och flexibilitet centralt. Vår bas är det moderna och hemtrevliga huvudkontoret i Växjö – en plats präglad av gemenskap och kreativitet. Vi söker i första hand dig som vill vara en del av vår vardag i Växjö, men det viktigaste för oss är att hitta rätt person.


Bor du på en annan ort? Du är lika välkommen med din ansökan! För oss fungerar det också om du utgår från något av våra andra kontor eller arbetar på distans, så länge du har möjlighet och vilja att besöka teamet i Växjö en till två gånger i månaden för att stärka gemenskapen och samarbetet.

**Fortnox - mitt i företagslivet**  

*Fortnox hjälper företag att starta, växa och utvecklas. Med smarta tekniska lösningar för företag och redovisningsbyråer, smidig finansiering och ett ekosystem av starka partnerskap är Fortnox ett nav för företagande i Sverige. Vi drivs av visionen om ett välmående samhälle format av framgångsrika företag.*

*Fortnox grundades 2001 med huvudkontor i Växjö. Läs mer på www.fortnoxgroup.com.*

 **Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: FPGA-utvecklare till Unibap i Uppsala
description:
**Om Unibap Space Solutions**
-----------------------------


På Unibap Space Solutions utvecklar och tillverkar vi hårdvara, mjukvara och tjänster för pålitlig och intelligent Edge Computing i rymden. Våra lösningar förbättrar realtidsövervakning och högkapacitetskommunikation och gör varje uppdrag mer agilt och kostnadseffektivt.

**Om jobbet**
-------------


Är du intresserad av en flexibel in-house-utvecklingsroll som låter dig utmana dig själv professionellt?


Vill du arbeta i ett skickligt team inom rymdindustrin?


Bli en del av vårt team som **FPGA-utvecklare** och hjälp till att forma banbrytande lösningar för våra kunder.


Ditt fokus kommer att ligga på att delta i design, utveckling och underhåll av Unibaps olika lösningar. Rollen innebär arbete med både datorhårdvara och mjukvarudesign för Unibaps produkter för rymden.

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
-------------------------------

* Utveckla nya generationer av satellitdatorer – från krav och design till test, underhåll och support
* Designa och implementera FPGA-baserade system
* Kommunicera och samarbeta med kunder och underleverantörer samt ge teknisk support
* Stödja olika delar av utvecklingsarbetet, från hårdvarudesign till mjukvaruanpassning, i både kund- och utvecklingsprojekt
* Skriva och granska dokumentation, inklusive krav, designbeskrivningar och produktionsunderlag
* Utveckla SystemVerilog/Verilog-kod, från design till implementering och verifiering

### **… och ibland**

* C-programmering av drivrutiner i Linux
* Delta i anbuds- och offertarbete
* Delta i arbete kring teknisk roadmap och planering av framtida utveckling
* Bidra till utveckling av Unibaps framework och applikationer

**Vi söker följande erfarenheter och färdigheter**
--------------------------------------------------

### **Tekniska färdigheter – krav**

* FPGA (helst Microsemi)
* SystemVerilog
* System Engineering
* C, C++
* FreeRTOS
* Linux

### **Meriterande färdigheter**

* Git
* VUnit
* Python
* Tcl

**Övriga krav**
---------------

* Flytande i svenska
* Goda kunskaper i engelska


Går du vidare i denna rekryteringsprocess kommer vi att genomföra en kontroll mot brottsregistret.


Tjänsten är placerad internt hos oss, men vissa uppdrag kan kräva placering i säkerhetsklass. Det innebär att du i sådana fall behöver genomgå en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585). För vissa uppdrag kan även svenskt medborgarskap vara ett krav från uppdragsgivaren.

**Om dig**
----------


Vi tror att du har arbetat i **minst fem år** med datorhårdvara och utveckling av inbyggda system, särskilt med FPGA:er. Du är driven, en lagspelare som tar initiativ och kommunicerar väl.


Du har god vana av att hantera krav, design och tester för att säkerställa rätt resultat, både vad gäller leverans och långsiktigt underhåll. Du är van att arbeta i projektform, kan prioritera ditt arbete, identifiera och kommunicera risker och föreslå alternativa lösningar vid behov.


Du har inget emot att bidra där det behövs och samarbeta med kollegor för att genomföra framgångsrika projekt och leverera produkter av hög kvalitet.

**Varför Unibap?**
------------------


På Unibap värdesätter vi samarbete, innovation och strävan efter att ligga i framkant i en spännande bransch. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och forma framtidens rymdteknik i en stödjande och engagerande miljö med utrymme att växa.

**Som anställd på Unibap Space Solutions AB erbjuds du bland annat:**

* 30 dagars semester
* En teknisk karriärväg med goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling
* Tjänstepension motsvarande ITP1
* Omfattande försäkringspaket inklusive privat sjukvård och hälsoundersökningar
* Årligt friskvårdsbidrag
* Generösa föräldraförmåner

**Ansökan:** Har du rätt kompetens för tjänsten och är nyfiken på att veta mer om Unibap? Skicka in din ansökan genom att klicka på ”Skicka ansökan”-knappen nedan och ta chansen att få träffa oss för att få reda på om Unibap kan vara din nästa arbetsgivare! Har du frågor kring rollen eller företaget är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Martin Winrow, 0707900205. Då urvalsprocessen och intervjuer sker löpande ser vi gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

title: Senior fullstackutvecklare C#/Javascript/SQL till team Produce - Ving
description:
**Till Ving söker vi en skicklig och driven fullstackutvecklare som vill vara en del av ett team där kvalitet, samarbete och teknisk innovation står i fokus.**

### **Om tjänsten**


Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare till team Produce. Teamet ansvarar för system som hanterar hotell, flyg och tillval. Det innefattar bland annat system för att planera, producera, optimera och hantera flygkapacitet och avgångar, både för kommande och pågående säsonger. Teamet bygger och ansvarar för flera affärskritiska system.


Teamets teknikstack innefattar bland annat:


* C#
* SQL
* Redis
* React
* Azure


Hos oss jobbar vi agilt i snabba releasecykler och med continuous delivery. Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan – från kravförståelse och utveckling till driftsättning, förvaltning och support. Vår strategi är ”Cloud first”, vilket gör att vi värdesätter kunskap om molnlösningar och Azure.


Tillsammans med teamet får du stort inflytande över arkitektur, skalning och prestanda i våra egenutvecklade system.


Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

* Samverka med stakeholders för att förstå behov och krav
* Designa och utveckla lösninga
* Säkerställa kvalitet genom t.ex. kodgranskningar och tester
* Automatisera infrastruktur och releaseflöden i Azure med IaC (Bicep m.m.), CI/CD samt observability practices
* Arbeta tillsammans med andra team för att leverera på helheten

### **Vår tekniska miljö**


Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på IT-avdelningen i Stockholm som tillsammans driver utvecklingen framåt. Våra system byggs i en modern Microsoft-miljö och vi arbetar med aktuella tekniker, ramverk och verktyg som .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, React Native, JavaScript, GraphQL, MS SQL och Redis.


I linje med vår cloud-first-strategi satsar vi på skalbara och framtidssäkra lösningar där innovation, prestanda och kvalitet alltid står i fokus.


Läs mer om **vår IT-avdelning här** ‍

### **Vem vi söker**


Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, noggrann och kommunikativ, och som trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Du brinner för kodning, ser värdet i samarbete för att nå gemensamma mål och tycker det är viktigt att förstå den verksamhet vi stöttar. Du har förmåga att arbeta proaktivt, se helheten och driva utvecklingen framåt.


Du har en god förmåga att kommunicera och samarbeta med dina kollegor, dela kunskap och bidra till en öppen och lärande kultur.


Vi söker en lagspelare som gärna delar med sig av sin kunskap, stöttar kollegor och bidrar till en öppen och lärande kultur. Vi värdesätter om du har intresse för DevOps och tycker om att arbeta med frågor som rör automatisering, CI/CD och infrastruktur som kod.

##### **Kvalifikationer:**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C#/.NET
* Intresse av arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade tjänster (gärna Azure)
* Erfarenhet av React eller liknande
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift

##### **Meriterande**

* Azure kompetens
* Erfarenhet av att automatisera infrastruktur och releaseflöden i Cloudmiljö (IaC, CI/CD)
* Erfarenhet av övervakning och monitorering
* Testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* Parprogrammering
* Intresse för generativ AI och förmåga att driva frågor inom området
* Erfarenhet av DevOps och förmåga att driva frågor inom området

### **Vi erbjuder**


Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete med andra team och verksamheten för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har ett högt medarbetarengagemang och en härlig kultur. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!


Läs mer om **vad vi erbjuder här**

### **Övrigt**


Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar för teamet/arbetsuppgiften.

 *Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!*

***I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett mer objektivt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Du får mer information när du skickat in din ansökan, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer hos*** ***Alva Labs******.***

***Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en bakgrundskontroll att genomföras.***
company_description: Ving är en av Sveriges ledande researrangörer med resor till drygt 400 resmål i över 60 länder. Ving är en del av den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for senior developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, or Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, or Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
* You have worked professionally as a Web Developer for at least 5 years.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
🚀 Hiring: Senior Backend Engineer & Full-Stack Engineer
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Hybrid – 3 days/week preferred)
 



**Type:** 
 Permanent
 



**Start:** 
 ASAP
 



  





 A well-funded
 **AI e-commerce startup** 
 is entering an exciting new phase of growth and is looking to strengthen its engineering team with
 **permanent hires** 
 . The company builds an end-to-end, white-label AI platform powering
 **search, recommendations, merchandising and product discovery** 
 for leading fashion and retail brands across Europe and the US.
 



  





 After a successful reset, the company is now lean, focused, financially strong, and executing against a clear roadmap. With profitability expected in
 **Q1 2026** 
 , this is a chance to join at exactly the right moment: high impact, real ownership, and no early-stage chaos.
 



  





**🧠 The Product** 



* AI-powered merchandising, ranking and recommendations
* Conversational
 **GPT-driven search** 
 replacing traditional keyword search
* Real-time analytics and insights for e-commerce brands
* Deep integrations with leading e-commerce platforms
* Built for scale, performance and relevance



  





**🧩 Open Roles** 




  





**1️⃣ Senior Backend Engineer** 




  





 You will own and evolve the backend systems that power real-time search, merchandising rules, recommendations and AI workflows used daily by high-traffic e-commerce brands.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Design and operate high-performance backend services using
 **Python & FastAPI**
* Build and maintain large-scale integrations with e-commerce platforms (syncs, webhooks, reconciliation)
* Work closely with ML engineers on
 **RAG systems, vector search and LLM workflows**
* Improve scalability and resilience (PostgreSQL, ClickHouse, caching, async processing)
* Run and harden production systems on
 **Kubernetes (GCP)**
* Take part in on-call rotation and raise operational standards



  





**What they’re looking for** 



* ~5+ years building production-grade backend systems
* Strong Python / FastAPI experience
* Solid distributed systems fundamentals (queues, async, caching, failure modes)
* PostgreSQL + data pipelines consuming multiple external APIs
* Hands-on Kubernetes experience in production
* Exposure to AI systems (LLMs, vector search, ML-powered services) is a strong plus
* Product-minded, pragmatic, and comfortable owning architecture and decisions



  





**2️⃣ Full-Stack Engineer** 




  





 A highly hands-on role combining backend depth with modern frontend work. You’ll build features that bring cutting-edge AI directly into the hands of users.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Build full-stack features with
 **Python/FastAPI** 
 and
 **TypeScript/React**
* Translate real customer needs into intuitive, high-impact UX
* Build robust, scalable applications used by global brands
* Work on deep integrations with e-commerce platforms
* Join the shared engineering on-call rotation



  





**What they’re looking for** 



* Strong Python (FastAPI) experience
* Frontend skills with React, TypeScript, HTML & CSS
* PostgreSQL and API-driven data pipelines
* Experience with
 **GCP, Kubernetes and Terraform**
* Interest or hands-on experience with AI/ML (RAG, LLMs, agents, prompt engineering)
* Startup mindset: adaptable, fast-moving, and highly hands-on



  





**💰 Compensation & Benefits** 



* Meaningful equity
* 30 paid vacation days
* 4,000 SEK annual wellness allowance
* Company laptop



  





**🌍 Working Mode** 
 l
 


* Hybrid:
 **3 days/week in the Stockholm office preferred**
* Exceptional candidates outside Stockholm may be considered, but local profiles are prioritised



  





**🧬 Culture & Environment** 



* High technical bar, no egos, very collaborative
* Fast-paced startup execution with a strong Swedish engineering culture
* Ideal for engineers with
 **startup or scale-up backgrounds**
* Engineers have real ownership, influence over architecture, and direct product impact

title: Software Engineer UniCore
description:
*MSAB is a global leader in digital forensic technology for mobile device examination and analysis. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions – for a safer world. A core value is to run an ethics-driven company with innovation and results. The sole focus of MSAB is on delivering high quality digital forensic solutions to collect, review, analyze and manage data. MSAB is a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defence Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption.* 




  





**Software Engineer – UniCore Technology (UCT)** 




  





 At MSAB, we’re building the foundational technology that powers the future of mobile forensics and data extraction for law enforcement and intelligence agencies worldwide. Our UniCore Technology (UCT) team is at the very heart of this mission, and we’re looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to help shape what comes next.
 



  





**What You’ll Be Doing** 



* Designing and implementing core components that will be used for years to come
* Working across the entire stack – from low-level system code to modern web frontends - Collaborating closely with a small, high-trust team of talented engineers
* Influencing architecture, tooling, and engineering culture



  





**We’d love to meet you if you** 



* Treat programming languages as tools, not tribes – our stack is primarily C/C++/C# with TypeScript for web
* Have strong opinions about what “good code” looks like: simple, readable, performant, and maintainable
* Enjoy solving hard, real-world problems that actually matter



  





**Bonus Points If You Bring Experience With** 



* CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices
* Distributed systems (concurrency, fault tolerance, resilience)
* Cryptology and cryptographic protocols
* Protocol Buffers and gRPC
* Deep Windows and/or Linux systems knowledge



  





**Who You Are** 



* Senior-level expertise in C/C++ and/or C# (we care more about depth than years)
* Self-driven, pragmatic, and low-ego
* Excited by the idea of owning significant parts of a critical codebase
* Eligible to work in Sweden



  





**Why MSAB** 



* Work on technology that has real impact in investigations and public safety
* Small engineering teams = big individual influence
* Solid benefits, and a healthy work-life balance
* Modern office in central Stockholm



  





 You need to have a Swedish or EU Work permit.
 



  





 There is much more to say about our growth plans, strategy, company culture, our values and how we create a safer world. But we save that to the interview.
 



  





 Welcome to apply now!
 



  





 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
 



  





**What we can offer** 




 Create a safer world with us!
 



 As one of the world’s leading digital forensics companies, MSAB leads the way in pioneering advancements that contribute to making our world safer.
 



 Your work at MSAB will bridge the gap between technology and justice. You will be inspired to go beyond your comfort zone, and you will deal with challenging and meaningful projects. When you join us, you become part of a global team that aspires to create a safer digital future, one breakthrough at a time.
 



 We can offer you an exciting work environment, where we value being innovative, acting ethically and delivering results in everything we do while our customers' needs are at the center. We are proud to be a fast-growing international company with more than 20+ nationalities and we work with things that really make a difference.
 



 Every day at MSAB is an opportunity to redefine the future of digital forensics.
 



 Are you up for the challenge?
 



 Department Development Role C++ Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Software Integration Engineer
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
 Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion following its recent Series F funding round, Applied Intuition delivers the Vehicle OS, Self-Driving System, and toolchain to help customers build intelligent vehicles and shorten time to market. 18 of the top 20 global automakers and major programs across the Department of Defense trust Applied Intuition's solutions to deliver vehicle intelligence. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining, and agriculture industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Washington, D.C., San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor, MI, London, Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Bangalore, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.
   

  

*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.*
**Meet our engineers on the Vehicle OS team!**
 Vehicle OS is a flexible suite of products that help vehicle manufacturers develop, deploy, and update complete vehicle software and AI applications. Learn more about what the team is building, the team culture, and why it’s one of the most exciting projects at Applied Intuition.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a software integration engineer who can champion the delivery of features in our newest product. This involves working across software and hardware to ensure that the full system is integrated together seamlessly when it needs to be delivered to the customer.
   

  

**At Applied Intuition, you will:**
* Deliver full-system features that span software and hardware that meet customer requirements
* Directly interact with the customers to identify the target use-cases, then manage the project to complete the integration
* Work cross-functionally with the product, software, mechanical and electrical teams to develop and deploy systems
* Develop a deep understanding of the entire system architecture and how the software and hardware components interact
* Design and bring up test rigs needed for end-to-end testing and validation of system performance
* Test and troubleshoot integration between various components to ensure reliability


**We're looking for someone who has:**
* 2+ years of experience in software integration or development
* An understanding of electronic systems and how how to setup and debug them
* Experience with developing or testing software applications
* Software development experience in Python or C/C++
* Familiarity with Linux development and Bash scripting


**Nice to have:**
* Experience in the automotive industry and working with automotive technologies including CAN, LIN, Ethernet, Simulink, AUTOSAR, etc
* Experience interacting with customers to deliver projects that meet their requirements
* Experience developing software for large projects (CI/CD, release process, etc)
* Familiarity with developing software for embedded systems
* Skills in other adjacent areas (CAD/3D printing, PCB design, etc)


**Benefits and** 
**perks** 
 :
   

  

* Lunch and dinner allowance
* Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
* Stock options


*Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*
*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: Senior Software Engineer (IaaS)
description:
Everyone's story matters. Come shape your story with us at Riverty.
   

  

**But where does that take you?**
 To one of our 30 hybrid workspaces – designed for exchanging ideas, learning from others, and shaping the way we work. An international community of over 4,000 people, representing almost 80 nationalities across 11 countries. United by one mission: Combining empathy, advanced technology and data-driven insights to keep people and businesses in flow. With payments made for them. So that they don't have to worry about it.
   

  

**And there's more:** 
 We are part of the family-owned Bertelsmann group. Established. Corporate. In a fast-paced industry. We enable flexible payments in various industries, simplifying the financial management of known brands and helping people repay debt to build financial confidence. In short: shaping FinTech.
   

  

**We are looking for**
**Senior Software Engineer**
**to join our team at our location in Stockholm**
**(Y)our Mission:**
 Our solutions contribute to flexible and customer-friendly payment alternatives. We allow consumers to choose when and how they want to pay, guaranteeing merchants a steady and predictable cash flow. Our products make us proud, but not content, and we have high ambitions for our existing and upcoming products. We’re now modernizing and strengthening one of our key products with renewed focus in the Nordics — backed by the strength of a global group, but with the energy and ownership of a startup. You’ll join a newly formed product & tech team, helping shape how we work and how we grow as we double down on building sustainable, human-centric FinTech solutions.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities:**
* In this role, you will work as a full-stack engineer, primarily focusing on backend tasks and having smaller front-end responsibilities. You will join one of our products, and your daily tasks will be:
* Design, develop, test, and ship robust, maintainable, and readable software, applications, APIs, and other workflows.
* Attend regular scrum ceremonies as a member of an agile cross-functional team.
* Analyze, discuss and implement business requirements while maintaining good documentation of the systems and components you create.
* Adopt, implement, and provide feedback on organizational and industry standards and practices that will positively impact on our engineering culture.


  

  

**What will help you to succeed in the role:**
* A university degree in the IT field
* Hands-on experience with C# and the .NET framework.
* Experience in frontend development with any modern JavaScript framework (e.g., Angular).
* Some experience in developing, shipping, and maintaining cloud-based applications.
* A good understanding of RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with microservices and distributed architecture is a plus.
* Experience with relational databases, preferably SQL Server.
* Knowledge of cloud development and experience with Azure is a bonus.
* Written and spoken English proficiency to communicate and collaborate with our international team.


**About the technologies we use:**
 Our teams have autonomy regarding tech choices. The example below will give you some insights, and we look forward to discussing this further.
   

  

 All solutions developed cloud-native targeting Azure - Infrastructure defined using Terraform - Services deployed to Kubernetes clusters by default - A growing microservice ecosystem with event-based integration - Using latest .NET Core - RESTful API design - Single-page frontend apps served by CDN - Frontend tech using TypeScript, often Angular or standard Web Components (Stencil) - Automated tests in each layer - Design collaboration using Figma.
   

  

 Equal Opportunity Employer Statement
   

  

 We want to be a fair and inclusive employer. We value the diverse perspectives that a diverse workforce brings to the table. Therefore, we are actively looking for people who enrich our company through their identity, background and personal experiences, with or without a disability.
   

  

**Benefits:**
* At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
* Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
* Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
* Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
* With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.

title: AI Software Developer i Stockholm
description:
Vi vill bygga en framtid där data, AI och mjukvara jobbar tillsammans, inte i silos. Därför satsar vi på att växa och söker AI Software Developers som vill göra det med oss.
   

  

 När vi växer gör dina möjligheter också det, du får vara med och påverka kulturen, affären och din roll. Vi bygger smarta lösningar och en kultur där nyfikenhet, samarbete och humor får ta plats. Då vi jobbar teknikagnostiskt får du stor frihet att forma teknikval och arkitektur för att möta affärsbehov.
   

  

 Här kliver du in
   

  

 Hos oss blir du del av ett växande område med runt 20 konsulter inom Cloud, AI och systemutveckling. Samtidigt får du kollegor från hela Solita med expertis i allt från data, strategi och mycket mer att dela kunskap och perspektiv med, läs mer om det här.
   

  

 Vi skapar en miljö där systemutvecklare, data engineers, data scientists och slutanvändare arbetar nära tillsammans för att snabbt leverera värde med hjälp av den senaste tekniken. Våra kunder finns i offentlig och privat sektor, i branscher från sjukvård till e-handel, transport och energi.
   

  

 En dag på Solita
   

  

 En dag på Solita kan börja med ett standup-möte med ditt team på kunduppdraget, ibland består det av fler kollegor från Solita. Är det fredag kanske du jobbar från Solitas kontor i Stockholm för att starta dagen med frukost. Andra dagar jobbar du från kundens kontor eller hemifrån.
   

  

 Sen kliver du in i ditt arbete: när du stöter på ett problem söker du upp en lång diskussionstråd i slack med insikter från kollegor som haft samma problem. Andra gånger passar du på att fråga en kollega vid kaffemaskinen om deras perspektiv för att komma vidare. Du kan också delta i våra interna utbildningsmöten, där vi delar kunskap om allt från nya teknologier och arbetssätt till välmående. Vissa dagar avslutar du med AW, filmkväll, brädspel eller annan aktivitet du och kollegor tycker är kul.
   

  

 Din roll som AI Software Developer
   

  

 I denna nya roll kommer du arbeta nära affärs- och teknikteam för att utveckla AI-lösningar som hjälper kunder att fatta bättre beslut och automatisera processer på ett intelligent sätt. Du får möjlighet att vara med i hela utvecklingscykeln för att både bygga AI-lösningar och bidra med idéer och strategier för att optimera deras effekt. Från att exempelvis skapa API-anslutningar till LLM-tjänster och MCP orkestrerade AI-agenter, till att utreda prompt optimering för stabila resulat. Du kan även vara med i förundersökningar, stötta i pre-sales och rekryteringen av nya kollegor.
   

  

 Känner du igen dig i följande?
   

  

 Du Kan Kommunicera På Svenska Och Engelska i Tal Och Skrift. Det Är Ett Plus Om Du Varit Konsult Tidigare, Det Huvudsakliga Är Din Förmåga Att Snabbt Komma In i Nya Sammanhang Och Lära Dig. Du Är Trygg i Rollen Tack Vare Din Erfarenhet Av
   

  

* Systemutveckling i C# .NET eller Java Spring Boot.
* RAG- eller AI-agentarkitektur
* Att bygga AI-drivna applikationer med ramverk som ex. Semantic Kernel, LangChain eller liknande.
* Att implementera molnbaserade AI-tjänster och produktionssätta AI-lösningar med hjälp av DevSecOps och IaC.


 Vi letar inte bara efter tekniska skills, vi vill jobba med dig som tar ansvar för att bygga rätt lösningar på rätt sätt genom att utmana med omtanke. Du ser kod som ett hantverk, inte bara ett medel till funktion: du bryr dig om kvalitet, läsbarhet och hållbarhet. Du kommer trivas hos oss om du tycker om att dela med dig av din kunskap lika mycket som du är nyfiken på- och lyfter andras.
   

  

 Vad vi erbjuder
   

  

 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss. Vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Meningsfulla projekt: Arbeta i en agil miljö där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom data, analys och utveckling


**Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande förmåner:**
 💰 Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad med möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande
   

  

 🏦 Pensionsavsättning i linje med ITP1 samt möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande vid inkomst över 8,07 inkomstbasbelopp
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 😃 Sjukvårdsförsäkring för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benifex (tidigare Benify).
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

 Vilka är vi?
   

  

 Solita är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med över 2000 medarbetare i 9 länder, varav ca 230 i Sverige. Vår storlek gör oss tillräckligt stora för att vara en stabil och innovativ arbetsgivare, men samtidigt tillräckligt små för att värna om våra medarbetare och kunder. Med bred kompetens inom digital transformation erbjuder vi en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Hos oss får du friheten att utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt.
   

  

 Intresserad av att höra mer?
   

  

 Låter det som en spännande möjlighet? Skicka in din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team som ligger i framkant av AI-utveckling!
   

  

 Om du har några frågor, skriv gärna till Rebecca Hammel på LinkedIn eller mailadressen rebecca.hammel@solita.se. Du kan också kontakta rekryteringsansvarig, Louise Doverholt på LinkedIn eller mailadressen louise.doverholt@solita.se .
   

  

 Hur ser processen ut?
   

  

 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en snabb och effektiv process. Du ansöker med CV eller LinkedIn och svarar på tre korta frågor. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
   

  

**Placeringsort för denna roll är i Stockholm, Sverige**
 ℹ️
 *Under julhelgen och årsskiftet kan vår återkoppling dröja något längre än vanligt. Vi hör av oss senast i andra halvan av januari. Tack för din förståelse och god fortsättning!*
 Sign up to our newsletter to hear about the latest news, upcoming events and open positions at Solita
   

  

 Subscribe

title: Lead Software Engineer, Back End - L5 (Bangkok based - Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state-of-the-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether it’s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, you’ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**In this Role, you'll get to:**
* Architecting and developing highly scalable, mission critical back end systems
* Owning a big chunk of Agoda’s system all the way from the north-star & vision down to the bytecode level
* Enabling impactful collaboration and cross-team projects on big projects, making a dent in the quality of our services, code & architecture
* Providing thoughtful feedback, nurture an inclusive engineering environment, and champion engineering fundamentals. Bring out the best from your fellow engineers.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities for optimization across the technology stack, focusing on cost, efficiency, velocity & dev happiness
* Exhibiting technical leadership throughout the broader organization, conveying complex technical trade-offs to non-techies such as business owners & C-suite executives.


**What you'll Need to Succeed:**
* Overall experience of 10+ years in software engineering roles
* Proven hands-on experience, Experience with owning production services with significant impact on design, development, deployment, monitoring & evolution
* Curiosity, staying a-breast on technological improvements and open source advancement.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Kotlin, Scala, Java, C#.
* Can perform deep research & take decisions on complex projects. Can easily toggle between running as a lone wolf and also works great as part of a pack
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical details to stakeholders at all levels.
* On top of being an expert in Back End, has understanding of challenges and trade-offs in the entire engineering universe, from Front End/ Mobile to Data Analytics
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand. (Relocation package is provided)**
 #Bengaluru #Hyderabad #SouthKorea #Berlin #London #Pakistan #Pune #SanFrancisco #SanJose #Seattle #TelAviv #Jakarta #Colombia #NewYork #Vietnam #Russia #Madrid #SaoPaulo #Noida #Toronto #Chennai #Singapore #Ukraine #UAE #Sunnyvale #BuenosAires #Austin #Barcelona #Nigeria #Mumbai #Paris #Egypt #Stockholm #Amsterdam #Romania #Serbia #NewDelhi #MountainView #Chile #Warsaw #Sydney #Bangladesh #Peru #SantaClara #Chicago #Gurgaon #Munich #Montreal #Bangkok #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Sr Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea | Stockholm
description:
**Senior Software Engineer – Build the Future of Health with Apotea 🚀**
 At
 **Apotea** 
 , Sweden’s leading online pharmacy, we’re reshaping how healthcare reaches people — smarter, faster, and more sustainably. Every system we optimize and every line of code we write brings us closer to a society where better health is accessible for everyone.
   

  

 Now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to take a leading role in developing and scaling the systems that power our entire operation — from seamless customer experiences to world-class logistics.
   

  

 This isn’t a role for someone who wants “just another dev job.” This is your chance to be part of a purpose-driven tech journey where your impact goes far beyond code.
   

  

**💡 Why this role matters**
 At Apotea, technology isn’t a support function — it’s our competitive edge. You’ll be joining the
 **core of Apoteas tech team** 
 , where uptime, performance, and innovation meet real-world impact. You’ll help us design and evolve the complex systems that keep millions of deliveries moving, pharmacies stocked, and customers cared for every single day.
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead by doing — combining deep technical skill with curiosity, initiative, and collaboration.
   

  

**👩‍💻 What You’ll Do**
**Design, build, and evolve** 
 high-performance systems that keep Apotea running at scale.
   

  

**Lead technical direction** 
 within projects and mentor other developers through complex problem-solving.
   

  

**Drive innovation** 
 through automation, modernization, and new integrations — from logistics partners to sister companies.
   

  

**Collaborate across teams** 
 to bridge business needs and technical execution.
   

  

**Strengthen reliability and scalability** 
 across our .NET ecosystem — keeping millions of transactions flowing seamlessly.
   

  

**Shape the future** 
 of Apotea’s tech landscape — your ideas will influence how we grow.
   

  

**🧠 Who You Are**
 You’re an experienced engineer who loves tackling complexity and turning it into clarity. You thrive in fast-paced environments where real impact is visible every day. You’re both hands-on and strategic — equally comfortable writing elegant .NET code as you are leading architectural discussions.
   

  

**You’ll Fit Right In If You**
* Write clean, maintainable C#/.NET code with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Understand system architecture, distributed systems, and data flow in complex environments.
* Have strong problem-solving and debugging skills — you stay calm under pressure and focused on solutions.
* Enjoy mentoring, sharing knowledge, and lifting others around you.
* Communicate effectively across technical and non-technical teams.


**🌟 Extra kudos if you bring**
 Experience in
 **logistics, e-commerce, or ERP/WMS systems** 
 .
   

  

 Familiarity with
 **cloud infrastructure** 
 ,
 **DevOps** 
 , or automation tools.
   

  

 A background in
 **integration projects** 
 or migration work.
   

  

 Swedish language skills — a plus, not a must.
   

  

**What Apotea Offers You**
 ✨ A role where your code impacts millions of people.
   

  

 ✨ The chance to work in Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company.
   

  

 ✨ An agile, flat organization where ideas matter more than titles.
   

  

 ✨ Growth opportunities: training, mentorship, and conferences.
   

  

 ✨ A collaborative, transparent culture where your voice counts.
   

  

 ✨ A meaningful mission – making healthcare more accessible while caring for the planet.
   

  

**❤️ About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Årsta, Lidingö, Morgongåva and Varberg.
   

  

 Follow us on social media to stay up to date on everything that's happening at Apotea
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
* Apply
* Screening interview
* Technical interview
* Culture fit interview
* Background check (mandatory in pharmacy industry)
* Offer 🎉


 📍 Location: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm
   

  

 🏢 Work model: We work on-site
   

  

 👤 Reports to: Head of IT Operations
   

  

**Ready to join the journey?**
 Don’t wait – interviews happen continuously, and the role may be filled quickly. Apply today and be part of building something bigger than just software.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health, and your work creates real change.*
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Senior Principal Software Engineer | Candy Crush Soda Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Want to create the world’s best mobile games?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Senior Principal Software Engineer to join our Kingdom. Our games are adored by hundreds of millions of people, and you’ll be helping build them. As well as contribute to the engine, systems and platforms that make them play brilliantly on any platform.
   

  

****Your role within the Kingdom****
 If you want to create amazing user experiences and entertainment for millions of players on the go, this is the right job for you.
   

  

 As part of the Central Technology team in Candy Crush Soda Saga, you will both design Soda’s long-term architecture and bring it to life by implementing end-to-end systems directly in our client code base. This role bridges big-picture system design with hands-on development, ensuring robust, maintainable, and high-performance solutions. You’ll also be the one to deliver reference implementations that teams can immediately adopt across the code base.
   

  

 Working closely with the tech leadership team, you will shape Soda’s technical strategy and ensure our architecture continues to evolve to support future success. Along the way, you’ll enjoy a creative, collaborative environment where your ideas are valued as much as your technical expertise.
   

  

****Your responsibilities will include:****
* Auditing Soda’s architecture, designing new systems, and improving existing ones
* Taking full ownership of new systems from concept through production-ready code, delivering examples for adoption across the client code base
* Collaborating with the the rest of the Technical Leadership in Soda to align on strategy
* Contributing high-quality, well-structured code to the client code base
* Coaching colleagues and serving as a role model for technical excellence


****Skills to create thrills****
 We equally value a passion for making great games, extensive hands-on coding experience, software architecture and knack of sharing great ideas. Are you a passionate and creative teammate? You are:
   

  

* Highly proficient in system design, with proven experience on architecting large and complex systems
* An expert in C++, with relevant experience of working with a large code bases
* Skilled at balancing architectural vision with pragmatic delivery, ensuring designs translate into production-ready solutions
* Passionate about games and would love to create the next big thing
* Driven by quality, polish, and pride in the solutions you deliver
* Proactive in taking technical ownership from design to implementation


* Experience in the Gaming Industry
* Experience with Android or iOS development
* Experience in working with memory / performance critical applications
* Experience in developing tools with scripting languages


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Tech Business Developer, Video Delivery Scaling
description:
**Description**
 Prime Video is changing the way millions of customers consume and interact with video content. Customers can gain unlimited access to over 40,000 movies and TV episodes through a Prime subscription, rent or purchase from over 180,000 titles, subscribe to incremental Channel (Paramount+, HBO Max, etc.) based content, and get exclusive access to premium live sports such as the UEFA Champions League (UCL), NBA and the NFL. If you are looking for an opportunity that will deliver significant positive impact to Prime Video’s growth for years to come, like the idea of your work playing out on a global scale, with all the complexity, nuance, and challenge of doing business with companies in virtually every country in the world, and prefer to work in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do, please read on.
   

  

 The Video Delivery Scaling team is looking for a Technical Business Developer to lead our video delivery expansion and scale in Europe, to support our future growth for live events and VOD (video on demand). As the leader, you will help define and set strategies to 1) procure and scale video delivery capacity in new and existing markets, 2) deploying solutions to successfully deliver exclusive live events at scale, including low latency UDP based live streaming, and 3) drive new strategic initiatives by partnering with leading companies across a variety of market segments to support the launch and growth of Prime Video's business. Some of the scaling and development activities include: 1) partnering with AWS, CDNs, ISPs, and mobile carriers to establish the right mix of network capacity and embedded cache deployments, 2) driving solutions that will improve playback performance for the long tail of customers streaming in remote locales and poor performing networks, 3) creating opportunities with regional carriers to more efficiently deliver live streams at scale with lower latency and better quality (e.g. multicast/broadcast), and 4) collaborating with a variety of internal teams including business development, legal, and deployment, to successfully implement strategic growth plans in new markets.
   

  

 The successful candidate will become a trusted advisor and a subject matter expert on regional capacity planning and delivery scaling/build out for Prime Video. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of CDN, familiar with peering and transit negotiations, ideally with personal experience managing business relationships and completing or overseeing similar negotiations in prior roles. The ideal candidate will have worked for a large-scale content provider or a Content Delivery Network (CDN) in a similar role. The ideal candidate will have experience and knowledge of the inner workings and critical components of a successful embedded caching program and video delivery technology.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Engage with CDN and ISP partners, establish relationships, negotiate contracts, ensure our customers have the bandwidth they need to view the content they want whenever and wherever they are.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 In a typical day, you will be working with third party partners to understand how much bandwidth they support, the quality of the bandwidth, and using that information build strategies to deliver to customers video streams of the highest quality.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Video Delivery Scaling team supports all Prime Video streaming, including VOD, channels, and live events for every country, where Prime Video is present.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s Degree in an IT related field, or at proven equivalent experience working in the Internet peering and embedded caching space, with strong understanding of the negotiation strategies involved in working with ISPs from all around the world.
* Technical experience with CDN architecture and embedded caching, and solid understanding of related topics in the data center space. Knowledge of IP peering ecosystems.
* Effective writing and communications skills.
* Bachelor’s Degree in an IT related field, or at least five years of equivalent experience working in the Internet peering and embedded caching space, with strong understanding of the negotiation strategies involved in working with ISPs from all around the world.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master's degree or MBA Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Corporate Services Sweden AB

title: Systemutvecklare PEGA
description:
Vi i söker en erfaren systemutvecklare med specialistkompetens inom Pega för ett heltidsuppdrag. Du blir en del av ett agilt team där fokus ligger på utveckling och leverans av lösningar utifrån teamets backlog. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med andra utvecklare, kravanalytiker och testare.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Utveckling och vidareutveckling av lösningar i Pega-plattformen enligt teamets prioriteringar
* Aktivt deltagande i planering, utveckling och leverans
* Säkerställa teknisk funktionalitet och integrationer mot kringliggande system
* Bidra till kontinuerlig förbättring av teamets arbetssätt och processer


 Önskad kompetens
   

  

* Flerårig erfarenhet som Pega-utvecklare

 Ansökan
   

  

 Vänligen skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt och bifoga:
